page.title: 12Religious Worship.
page.content: The area covers parts of three Anglican Ecclesiastical parishes, part of a United Benefice of five parishes. It is in the Diocese of Oxford. Between the three churches there are two Communion services and an Evensong every Sunday. Daily in Turville Church prayers are said for PEACE and reconciliation which attract congregations from far afield. In 1985, for the first time since the Reformation, a Roman Mass was celebrated in Turville Church, coupled with a pilgrimage to and from Stonor, the home of a strong Roman Catholic family. The sizable Roman Catholic community worship in churches in neighbouring towns. There is a United Reform Church in the neighbouring village of Hambleden for Non-Conformists.
